reviews.review: literally dont even buy this. not on sale or anything. this matchmaking has ruined this game. the amount of bugs with each update is unbearable. i really wouldnt mind this game if it had decent matchmaking. but i dont like games that put me with other players that are no where near where my skill level is. you base a matchmaking system on kills/deaths??? thats terrible, now you just get tunneled and camped every game as survivor, but if you play killer then you are gonna get the most toxic people out there?? fix the system. I forgot to mention. this game is just a grind, 300 hours in and im still unable to make a single build i want to. i actually struggle to call this a game at this point

Played the game for quite some time now and I have mixed feelings. Dead by Daylight really lives up to the whole 4v1 style of gameplay, and seeing that this is pretty much the only game of its kind it doesn't really have that much competition. I personally enjoy the game when I'm playing casually, but through hundreds of hours I've noticed that the game is far from perfect. I can talk all day about the rank system that was and the new MMR system that is now, but to make it short I'll state it like this: 
The old rank system was flawed considering you had no idea what kind of survivors or killers you would be up against, and usually they would not match your own skill by either being better or worse. This was fixed when the MMR system was introduced
Now onto the MMR system.. There are simple ways to make the game more balanced, and they have done that to the extent that now you will be matched with people closer to your level of skill. But the issue I have is the way you gain MMR on both the killer and the survivor side. The developers have said that as a survivor you can escape and that counts as a win, and as killer you kill someone and you win. This makes it so that survivors that do nothing all game and wait by the exit gate, and killers that camp hooks will climb in MMR and eventually be much higher MMR than they're supposed to/deserve to be at, making the system close to being just as flawed as it was before. The games are more enjoyable, don't get me wrong, but this system that they have promotes camping and not being a team player since the devs have made it clear that THIS is the way you climb. Not how much you loop the killer to buy time for your other survivors, or not how many survivors you've hooked or caught in a chase etc.,something I think would work much better as a tracker of MMR. 

I can talk all day about this, but I can leave it at that. 
Despite the issues the game has, I still play the game and enjoy it, and I would recommend this game for people that like this kind of genre and playstyle. I've had it for over 3 years now, and I can admit that the game has only gotten better, and I hope it continues that way. The variety of survivors and killers you can play as are immense and adding the element of climbing and grinding, something you're going to have to do a lot of in this game, and that's part of the fun. The more you grind the more you understand the game on all aspects, and it makes succeeding way more satisfying and enjoyable. 

Despite the rant about the MMR system I would 100% recommend this game considering its the best its ever been. I encourage old players to come back and new players to give it a try.

Like most multiplayer games, it has very sweaty and toxic players but I like the concept of the game and the replay-ability of it which is what ultimately keeps me playing.
Behaviour Interactive has a long way to go until the game is fully balanced with the unfair aspect of still being matched with players using OP add-ons when you probably just wanna lay back, making the game practically unwinnable.
Unlike what they have said in the past, they have not "done a pretty good job so far".

Hopefully they'll get there though because this is a game that I do enjoy, at the end of the day.

This game is so much fun! I bought this during the September sale, so bought a few dlcs as well; both survivor and killer are fun roles to play, and I enjoy completing the daily rituals and rift challenges - they encourage you to play both roles, as well as try out different characters or tactics that you may not use normally. There is lore to unlock through challenges which is cool to see, and I really like the perks system.

This game does contain micro-transactions, in the form of a monthly pass and in-game currency packs - none of which are necessary to purchase of course, but provide some different cosmetic items and decorations to add to your collection. It also allows you to earn some in-game currency, which unfortunately isn't available in the free tiers from what I could see, but there is a bit of value back in what you spend to unlock the pass ($14.40 AUD).

Highly recommend purchasing some of the dlc chapters as each killer has a different ability, which is fun to experiment with and learn. This game is fantastic with friends, but playing solo is just as good; there is no in-game voice chat so you aren't missing anything if you don't particularly enjoy using it.

This game is still receiving updates and new content and finding matches is pretty easy, especially with cross-platform support.

If you are looking for a spooky 4v1 game with hours of play, this is it. This has very quickly become a favourite of mine, and I look forward to future chapters.
